intro: Lasiandra macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited lasiandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruits are fleshy, berry-like structures that contain seeds. Lasiandra macrocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal regions.
